Key Arguments: The legislation infringes on freedom of speech, which is considered an inalienable right.
The bill will suppress debate and the exchange of individual viewpoints.
The government should not have the authority to determine what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
There is skepticism about the government's exemption from the legislation and concerns about potential government errors.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is an inalienable right.
Shutting down debate, which is what this bill will do, is not the world I want my children to grow up in.
It's not up to the government to decide what truth is.
